newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa called to open $5 to $10 lower.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa called to open $5 to $10 lower.

text.p: CSCE cocoa futures were called to open $5 to $10 lower Friday in line with a weak performance in London overnight, traders said.
LIFFE cocoa futures slumped early Friday in thin pre-holiday trade, with July down seven stg at the midday break at 1,022 stg a tonne and Sepember slipping nine stg to 1,039 stg.
London and U.S. markets are closed on Monday for holidays.

Thursday, New York cocoa futures erased early gains and ended broadly lower, pressured by chart-driven speculative selling. July ended down $23 at $1,463 a tonne after trading from $1,498 to $1,460. Second-month September slid $19 to $1,493, while the back months slumped $18.

Technically, traders pegged near-term July support at $1,460-$1,459, followed by $1,445. On the upside, resistance was seen at $1,476 and $1,483. ((--Patricia Avidan, New York Commodity Desk 212 859 1640))
